```{r}
nodes <- boston_cocktails %>% 
  distinct(name, ingredient) %>% 
  count(name, sort = T) %>% 
  filter(n >= 5) %>% 
  filter(name %in% color_cocktail)
 
cocktail_list <- boston_cocktails %>% 
  distinct(name, ingredient) %>% 
  semi_join(nodes) %>% 
  mutate(temp = name) %>% 
  group_by(ingredient) %>% 
  summarize(to = list(name))
  
edges <- boston_cocktails %>% 
  distinct(name, ingredient) %>% 
  semi_join(nodes) %>% 
  inner_join(cocktail_list) %>% 
  unnest(to) %>% 
  separate_rows(to, sep = ",") %>% 
  rename(from = name) %>% 
  filter(from != to) %>% 
  count(from, to, name = "size") %>% 
  mutate(temp = ifelse(from > to, paste0(to, from), paste0(from, to))) %>% 
  distinct(temp, .keep_all = T) %>% 
  select(-temp)

graph <- tbl_graph(nodes, edges)

top <- graph %>% 
  activate(nodes) %>% 
  mutate(degree = centrality_degree()) %>% 
  as_tibble() %>% 
  top_n(1, degree) %>% 
  pull(name)

edge_pos <- which(nodes$name == top)

```

```{r}
cocktail_plot <- graph %>% 
  activate(nodes) %>% 
  mutate(color = if_else(name == top, "darkgoldenrod3", "darkblue"),
         stroke = if_else(name == top, 2, .5),
         alpha = if_else(name == top, 1, .8)) %>%
  activate(edges) %>% 
  mutate(edge_color = if_else(from == edge_pos | to == edge_pos, "darkgoldenrod3", "bisque4"),
         edge_alpha = if_else(from == edge_pos | to == edge_pos, 1, 0.7),
         edge_size = if_else(from == edge_pos | to == edge_pos, 2, 0.5)) %>% 
  ggraph(layout = "linear") + 
  geom_edge_arc(aes(edge_alpha = edge_alpha,
                    edge_color = edge_color, 
                    edge_width = size), 
                show.legend = FALSE) +
  geom_node_point(aes(fill = "bisque3", color = color, 
                      stroke = stroke), 
                  shape = 21, 
                  size = 9) +
  geom_node_text(aes(label = name), repel = T, color = "white", family = "Josefin Sans", size = 6) +
  labs(x = NULL,
       y = NULL,
       title = "Boston Cocktail Names with Colors",
       subtitle = "<span style='color:darkgoldenrod3'>**Golden Dawn**</span><span style = 'color:bisque2'> is most connected in relation to Boston cocktail names with colors.</span>",
       caption = "Source: Kaggle & Kaggle | Graphic: Sung Inkyung") +
  scale_edge_width_continuous(range = c(0.5, 6)) +
  scale_edge_color_identity() +
  scale_color_identity() +
  scale_alpha_identity() +
  scale_fill_identity() +
  theme(plot.background = element_rect(fill = "darkorchid4", color = NA),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "darkorchid4", color = NA),
        plot.title = element_text(color = "darkseagreen2",
                                  family = "Comfortaa",
                                  size = 30, face = "bold",
                                  margin = margin(b = 10)),
        plot.subtitle = element_markdown(family = "Fjalla One",
                                         size = 21,
                                         margin = margin(b = 15)),
        plot.caption = element_text(color = "azure3",
                                    family = "Josefin Sans",
                                size = 13,
                                hjust = 1,
                                margin = margin(t = 20, b = 10)),
        axis.text.x = element_blank(),
        axis.text.y = element_blank(),
        plot.margin = margin(10, 20, 10, 20))
        
        
ggsave("W22_Cocktails.png", width = 50, height = 28, units = "cm")
```


```{r do not run}
# color based cocktails
cocktail_colors <- boston_cocktails %>% 
  filter(name %in% color_cocktail)

pairs <- cocktail_colors %>% 
  distinct(name, ingredient) %>% 
  mutate(ingredient = tolower(ingredient)) %>% 
  add_count(ingredient) %>% 
  filter(n >= 3) %>% 
  pairwise_cor(ingredient, name, sort = T)

gin_plot <- pairs %>% 
  filter(item1 == "gin") %>% 
  head(10) %>% 
  mutate(item2 = fct_reorder(item2, correlation)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(correlation, item2)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(title = "What ingredients are most correlated with gin?") +
  theme_minimal()


pairs %>% 
  head(150) %>% 
  graph_from_data_frame() %>% 
  ggraph(layout = "fr") +
  geom_edge_link(aes(edge_color = correlation), edge_width = 1) +
  geom_node_point(aes(label = name), repel = T) +
  geom_node_text(aes(label = name), repel = T) +
  scale_edge_color_continuous(low = "#feab8a", high = "#213e52") +
  labs(title = "Correlation of  Boston Cocktails Names including Colors",
       caption = "Source: Kaggle & Kaggle | Graphic: Sung Inkyung") +
  theme_void()
```
